name: theatrical
content:
theatrical adjective
(PERFORMING ARTS)
Add to word list
Add to word list
belonging or relating to the theatre, or to the performance or writing of plays, opera, etc.: theatrical make-up He translated "Romeo and Juliet" into Arabic for a theatrical production he plans to direct. The festival features visual art, theatrical performances and music at various Austin venues. The singer has made her theatrical debut on the West End stage.
US in a cinema: The film will have its theatrical release in San Francisco, New York and a few other large cities in August. The wait for the film's theatrical debut has been a long one - more than a year.
More examplesFewer examplesMidnight Society is a theatrical adaptation of Pierre Choderlos de Laclos' 1782 novel, Les Liaisons Dangereuses.The film is scheduled for TV, not a theatrical release.The film won't have a regular theatrical run in Atlanta until May.

theatrical adjective
(BEHAVIOUR)

More examplesFewer examples"She was very theatrical," he said. "She had a wild imagination."You may be accused of being theatrical, but that's better than allowing the moment to pass without comment.
